title: Joe Biden Names Susan Rice to Lead White House Domestic Policy Council
sub_head: President-elect tasks Obama-era veteran with mapping his agenda on issues including health care and climate change
body:
WASHINGTON—President-elect Joe Biden has chosen Susan Rice, a former U.S. ambassador to the United Nations, to lead the White House Domestic Policy Council, as he fills out his government with veterans of the Obama administration.
Ms. Rice served as U.N. ambassador at the beginning of the Obama administration and later became President Barack Obama’s national security adviser. In that role, she worked closely with then-Vice President Biden, including during daily intelligence briefings.
Mr. Biden’s transition team announced four other nominees on Thursday, two of them Obama administration veterans.
Mr. Biden will nominate former Agriculture Secretary Tom Vilsack to return to his role leading the federal agency and Denis McDonough, who served as White House chief of staff in the Obama administration, to lead the Department of Veterans Affairs.
He will also nominate Rep. Marcia Fudge of Ohio to lead the Department of Housing and Urban Development and Katherine Tai, the chief trade counsel for the Democrats on the House Ways and Means Committee, as U.S. Trade Representative. The Wall Street Journal had previously reported Mr. Vilsack, Ms. Fudge and Ms. Tai’s new roles.
